result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Chad C Catlin was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
BAIL APPLIED TO DNA. PAID IN FULL
BAIL APPLIED TO FINE. FIND PAID IN FULL

Attorney Sarvan Singh appeared by telephone.   Defendant Chad C Catlin did not appear.  John Woodson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. If defendant is released in Dane County, he is to be brought to Waukesha County.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 11/24/15 Motion to Suppress.  Lisa Zinda, court reporter.

Defendant Chad C Catlin in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1:39 pm -  Case called for the Motion to Suppress Evidence based on lack of probable cause. Deputy Bauer from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. Redirect by the defense. State rests. Defense presents further arguments about the liability of the stop and the unlawful expansion of the search during the field tests. State presents further arguments about the field tests and the DRE being called to the stop. Court takes the matter under advisement. Any briefs filed by the defense to be filed by 01/08/2016 and the state has until 01/15/2016 to respond.  Oral ruling scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Chad C Catlin in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Bauer from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects to bind over and presents arguments. State presents further arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
